objinfo.printdate: 1795The characteristics of the color printing indicate that this impression is the first one printed in 1795. The second impression in this printing is *Satan Exulting Over Eve* in the J. Paul Getty Museum (Butlin 292).
objinfo.medium: planographic color printing with water color and pen and ink additions to the impression

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Possibly acquired directly from Blake by Thomas Butts in 1805, although not one of the color printed drawings listed in the Blake/Butts accounts; possibly Thomas Butts, Jr., by inheritance in 1845; possibly the work sold as "Satan Traversing the Realms of Space" from the Butts Collection, Foster's auction, 29 June 1853, lot 83, with two other works by Blake (£1.2s.6d. to John Clark Strange, who owned "Satan Exulting over Eve" by 1863); Bernard Quaritch, the London book dealer, who offered the print in his sale catalogues 218 of November 1902, item 261 (£42), 228 of March 1904, item 314 (£40), 273 of March 1909, item 288 (£40), and in his *Catalogue of Works on the Fine Arts* of 1909-10, item 288 (£40); Greville Macdonald by 1914; Francis Edwards, the London book dealer, who offered the print in his catalogue 654 of 1941 (£30); sold by Edwards in 1942 to the artist John Craxton; acquired by the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) from Craxton's estate in 1969.

objnote.p: "Satan Exulting over Eve" takes its subject from the story of the fall in Genesis 3:1-6, but the design was also influenced by Eve's dream of Satan and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil in John Milton's *Paradise lost*, Book 5. Neither source, however, offers a precedent for Blake's double representation of Satan. His still human and angelic form, armed with shield and spear, hovers over the sleeping Eve, but his bat-like wings indicate his fallen condition. His serpentine form coils around Eve's lower body, arches over her head, and rests its crested head on her chest. Her right hand lies limply over the forbidden fruit.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Satan, nude, muscular and bat-winged, hovers over the supine form of Eve. He raises his arms at an angle between the horizontal and 135 degrees (relative to the ground below) with his lower body horizontal, his upper body twisted upward, and his left leg (the right is not pictured) extended to the right. With his right hand, he clasps a shield that is fastened with a strap to his elbow. In his left hand he holds an arrow-pointed spear. A serpent twines around Eve’s bare right foot, coils around her right leg and lower body, arches over her limp, backward-bent head, and rests its spiky, crested head on her breast. Eve has long, curly hair and lies with her legs together (?) and her right arm at her side. Her right hand rests limply, fingers slightly spread, on the forbidden fruit. Eve lies on grass, moss, lichens, or some such vegetation. Her eyes are closed; she may be sleeping or in a trance. Flames mount upward from right to left from behind Eve's body and rise above Satan’s head. The sky upper right is dark.

component.illusobjdesc: Satan, nude, muscular and bat-winged, hovers over the supine form of Eve. He raises his arms at an angle between the horizontal and 135 degrees (relative to the ground below) with his lower body horizontal, his upper body twisted upward, and his left leg (his right is not pictured) extended to the right. With his right hand, he clasps a shield fastened to his elbow with a strap. In his left hand he holds an arrow-tipped spear. Satan’s hair is short and curly. Although his lower body faces left, Satan’s head and upper body are twisted forward and face the viewer. Satan’s eyes look out and to the right.

component.characteristic: Satan clasps a shield in his right hand that is fastened to his elbow with a strap (or short belt).

component.illusobjdesc: Satan holds an arrow-pointed spear in his left hand that he points downward and to the right.
Satan's serpent-form twines around Eve's lower body, wraps around her bare right foot, arches over her limp, backward-bent head, and rests its crested head on her breast. The serpent's skin is scaly.

Supine, limp, and serpent-coiled, Eve lies below exultant Satan. She has long, curly hair, and lies with her right arm at her side. Her right hand rests, fingers limply spread, on the forbidden fruit. Only her extended right leg is clearly pictured, but some flesh coloring above the right leg suggests the presence of her left leg (in which case Eve's legs are together). Her bare right foot is prominent, framed by one of the serpent's coils. Her mouth is slightly open and her eyes are closed. She may be sleeping or in a trance.
Eve's limp hand rests on the forbidden fruit, which resembles an apple with a leaf or two on its stem.
Flames mount upward from right to left from behind Eve's body and rise above Satan's head. The sky at upper right is dark, perhaps with smoke or clouds (possibly at night).
Eve lies on grass, moss, lichens, or some such vegetation.

lg.l: BlakeBlake's signature is incised into the pigment.
